intro: Epilobium × wimmeri, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist habitats such as riverbanks, wet meadows, and woodland edges. Epilobium × wimmeri is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
